page.title: 06part 2 THE IRON LADY
page.content: 1964 THE TORIES WENT INTO OPPOSITION AND MRS T WAS APPOINTED AS{SPOKESMAN {FOR HOUSING.}DURING HER TIME IN OPPOSITION SHE HAD VARIOUS {RESPONSIBILITIES}(1967,POWER; 1968, TRANSPORT; 1969, EDUCATION). THIS TIME IN OPPOSITION GAVE HER TIME TO REALLY CONCENTRATE ON{CONSTITUENCY MATTERS.} NOTABLY THE RELEASE IN JULY 1969 FROM THE SOVIETS OF{GERALD BROOKE}A FINCHLEY CONSTITUENT. 1970 THE TORIESWON THE GENERAL ELECTION AND MRS T TOOK ON HER MOST IMPORTANT JOB TO DATE{MINISTER FOR} {EDUCATION.}THE NEXT 4 YEARS WERE TO BE AMONGST THE MOST DEMANDING OF HER CAREER.IN 1974 THE TORIES WENT INTO OPPOSITION AGAIN AS TED HEATH RESIGNS AS PARTY LEADER.MRS THATCHER WINS THE ENSUING FIGHT AND BECOMES THE{FIRST} {LADY LEADER}OF A POLITICAL PARTY AND SOON GAINED THE NAME'THE IRON LADY'.
